content: The Flood Insurance Fairness Act of 2010 delays the mandatory purchase requirement for new flood hazard areas by 5 years. Amendments to the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 include rules of construction and conforming amendments, with no refunds provided. The Flood Insurance Fairness Act of 2010 delays mandatory purchase requirement for new flood hazard areas by 5 years, with no refunds for flood insurance coverage purchased during non-required periods. SEC. 3. 5-YEAR PHASE-IN OF FLOOD INSURANCE RATES FOR NEWLY MAPPED AREAS. Section 1308 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to include a 5-year phase-in of flood insurance rates for newly mapped areas that are designated as special flood hazards. The National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to include a 5-year phase-in of flood insurance rates for newly mapped areas designated as special flood hazards. The chargeable premium rate for flood insurance under this title for such areas will gradually increase over the 5-year period. The National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to include a 5-year phase-in of flood insurance rates for newly mapped areas designated as special flood hazards. The chargeable premium rate for flood insurance under this title for such areas will gradually increase over the 5-year period, starting at 40 percent in the first year and reaching 100 percent in the fifth year. SEC. 4. Reimbursement of property owners for costs incurred in requests to remove property from base flood elevations. Section 1360 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to include a new subsection (k) regarding reimbursement of property owners for expenses incurred in requesting to remove their property from base flood elevations. If the Director approves the request, the property owner will be reimbursed for expenses related to surveyors, engineers, or similar services, excluding legal services. The reimbursement amount will be based on the successful portion of the request compared to the entire request, using the average cost of such services in the community for similar jobs. SEC. 5. The Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency must submit a community outreach plan for updating floodplain areas and flood-risk zones within 60 days of this Act's enactment. No revisions to floodplain areas or flood-risk zones can occur until the plan is submitted. SEC. 6. Notification of establishment of flood elevations. SEC. 6. Notification of establishment of flood elevations. The Director must notify Senators and House Members of any revisions or updates to floodplain areas or flood-risk zones in writing.
